EQUIPMENT.name: Light Laser Cannon
EQUIPMENT.description: Laser Cannons are the most common Starship weapons. They generally have better Range than Blaster Cannons but are somewhat more expensive.

EQUIPMENT.name: Medium Laser Cannon
EQUIPMENT.description: Laser Cannons are the most common Starship weapons. They generally have better Range than Blaster Cannons but are somewhat more expensive.

EQUIPMENT.name: Heavy Laser Cannon
EQUIPMENT.description: Laser Cannons are the most common Starship weapons. They generally have better Range than Blaster Cannons but are somewhat more expensive.

EQUIPMENT.name: Proton Torpedo Launcher
EQUIPMENT.description: Base Capacity: 3 torpedoes. Additional capacity costs +25% per torpedo (max 16).

EQUIPMENT.name: Light Ion Cannon
EQUIPMENT.description: Ion Cannons deal Ion damage. Starship-mounted Ion Cannons are generally defense armament.

EQUIPMENT.name: Medium Ion Cannon (5d10x2)
EQUIPMENT.description: Ion Cannons deal Ion damage. Most Starship-mounted Ion Cannons do not have a high enough rate of fire for Autofire.

EQUIPMENT.name: Heavy Ion Cannon
EQUIPMENT.description: Ion Cannons deal Ion damage. Most Starship-mounted Ion Cannons do not have a high enough rate of fire for Autofire.

EQUIPMENT.name: Hapan Triple Ion Cannon
EQUIPMENT.description: Acts like a Point-Defense Weapon (no penalty for targets smaller than Colossal). Capable of Autofire, but not Starship Scale Area Attacks. Illegal outside Hapan Consortium.

EQUIPMENT.name: Light Concussion Missile Launcher
EQUIPMENT.name_es: Lanzador de Misiles de Concusión Ligero
EQUIPMENT.description: Base Capacity: 6 missiles. Additional capacity costs +20% per missile (max double capacity).

EQUIPMENT.name: Medium Concussion Missile Launcher
EQUIPMENT.name_es: Lanzador de Misiles de Concusión Mediano
EQUIPMENT.description: Base Capacity: 16 missiles. Additional capacity costs +20% per missile (max double capacity).

EQUIPMENT.name: Heavy Concussion Missile Launcher
EQUIPMENT.name_es: Lanzador de Misiles de Concusión Pesado
EQUIPMENT.description: Base Capacity: 30 missiles. Additional capacity costs +20% per missile (max double capacity).

EQUIPMENT.name: Tractor Beam
EQUIPMENT.description: Tractor Beams prevent another Vehicle from escaping instead of dealing damage. If the attack hits, make an opposed Grapple check. Smaller targets are immobilized and lose Dex bonus. Larger targets can be pulled closer. Docking Clamps allow boarding.

EQUIPMENT.name: Atmospheric Thrusters
EQUIPMENT.description: Atmospheric Thrusters increase a Starship's speed when the ship is flying in the atmosphere of a planet. Standard Atmospheric Thrusters increase a Starship's maximum velocity and fly speed by 10% (rounded down to the nearest square of speed and 10 km/h). Atmospheric Thrusters have no effect on Starship Scale movement.

EQUIPMENT.name: Atmospheric Thrusters (Advanced)
EQUIPMENT.description: Advanced Atmospheric Thrusters increase these by 25% (rounded down to the nearest square of speed and 10 km/h). Atmospheric Thrusters have no effect on Starship Scale movement.

EQUIPMENT.name: Combat Thrusters
EQUIPMENT.description: Often used by smugglers, bounty hunters, and blockade runners. A ship with Combat Thrusters is treated as one size category smaller than its actual size category for the purpose of being targeted by Capital Ship weapons. Additionally, the Space Transport is treated as a Starfighter for the purpose of Dogfighting and Starship Maneuvers. This Starship Modification does not change the ship's size modifier to Reflex Defense.

EQUIPMENT.name: Maneuvering Jets (+2)
EQUIPMENT.description: Maneuvering Jets give a Starship a +2 Equipment bonus to its Dexterity score.

EQUIPMENT.name: Maneuvering Jets (+4)
EQUIPMENT.description: Maneuvering Jets give a Starship a +4 Equipment bonus to its Dexterity score.

EQUIPMENT.name: Maneuvering Jets (+6)
EQUIPMENT.description: Maneuvering Jets give a Starship a +6 Equipment bonus to its Dexterity score.

EQUIPMENT.name: Hyperdrive Class .75
EQUIPMENT.description: The best Hyperdrive ever created is the Class .5 (which can be created by modifying a Class .75 Hyperdrive using the Starship Designer Feat). Class .5 drives are Illegal, require heavy maintenance (8h/month, DC 20 Mechanics), and impose penalties if neglected.

EQUIPMENT.name: Hyperdrive Class 1
EQUIPMENT.description: The Class 1 Hyperdrive is considered the pinnacle of stable Hyperdrive technology from the Clone Wars forward. It is the favored technology of military vessels, but its high cost often results in designers settling for a Class 2 or Class 3 drive.

EQUIPMENT.name: Hyperdrive Class 1.5
EQUIPMENT.description: Class 1.5 is a standard performance hyperdrive.

EQUIPMENT.name: Hyperdrive Class 2
EQUIPMENT.description: Class 2 was state of the art during most of the Rise of the Empire era.

EQUIPMENT.name: Hyperdrive Class 3
EQUIPMENT.description: Class 3 was state of the art during most of the Rise of the Empire era.

EQUIPMENT.name: Hyperdrive Class 4
EQUIPMENT.description: A Hyperdrive of Class 4 to Class 6 is normally either old technology or an aftermarket retrofit crammed into a vessel not designed to support a Hyperdrive.

EQUIPMENT.name: Hyperdrive Class 6
EQUIPMENT.description: A Hyperdrive of Class 4 to Class 6 is normally either old technology or an aftermarket retrofit crammed into a vessel not designed to support a Hyperdrive.

EQUIPMENT.name: Hyperdrive Class 8
EQUIPMENT.description: Backup Hyperdrives, usually ranging from Class 8 to Class 15, are often used as emergency systems. Though no one wants to wait a month to arrive someplace when using a Class 10 Backup Hyperdrive, often the alternative is to drift aimlessly in space for centuries.

EQUIPMENT.name: Hyperdrive Class 10
EQUIPMENT.description: Backup Hyperdrives, usually ranging from Class 8 to Class 15, are often used as emergency systems. Though no one wants to wait a month to arrive someplace when using a Class 10 Backup Hyperdrive, often the alternative is to drift aimlessly in space for centuries.

EQUIPMENT.name: Hyperdrive Class 15
EQUIPMENT.description: Backup Hyperdrives, usually ranging from Class 8 to Class 15, are often used as emergency systems. Though no one wants to wait a month to arrive someplace when using a Class 10 Backup Hyperdrive, often the alternative is to drift aimlessly in space for centuries.

EQUIPMENT.name: Navicomputer
EQUIPMENT.description: A Navicomputer is an astrogation calculator designed to make all the calculations necessary to travel through Hyperspace. Most Starships have Navicomputers, but those that lack Hyperdrives and some fighters that depend on Astromech Droids do not.

EQUIPMENT.name: Navicomputer (Limited)
EQUIPMENT.description: Most Navicomputers are Nonstandard Modifications for Starfighters - these ships simply don't have the room for the memory core. Starfighters often have Limited Navicomputers that store only two jumps' worth of information, enough to get to a destination and return.

EQUIPMENT.name: Navicomputer (Advanced)
EQUIPMENT.description: Advanced Navicomputers grant a +10 bonus on Use Computer checks made for Astrogation, rather than a typical Navicomputer's +5 bonus. Additionally, a character aboard a ship that has a Navicomputer need not be Trained in the Use Computer Skill to make use of the Astrogation aspect of the Skill.

EQUIPMENT.name: SubLight Accelerator Motor
EQUIPMENT.description: A SLAM system provides a +5 bonus on Pilot checks to increase a Vehicle's Speed. This bonus increases to +10 if the Pilot is using All-Out Movement.

EQUIPMENT.name: Sublight Drive (Speed 1)
EQUIPMENT.description: A Sublight Drive determines a ship's Speed when moving through Realspace. Replacing a ship's Sublight Drive can be expensive, and many ships cannot reach high speeds due to the bulk of their Sublight Drives.

EQUIPMENT.name: Sublight Drive (Speed 2)
EQUIPMENT.description: A Sublight Drive determines a ship's Speed when moving through Realspace. Replacing a ship's Sublight Drive can be expensive, and many ships cannot reach high speeds due to the bulk of their Sublight Drives.

EQUIPMENT.name: Sublight Drive (Speed 3)
EQUIPMENT.description: A Sublight Drive determines a ship's Speed when moving through Realspace. Replacing a ship's Sublight Drive can be expensive, and many ships cannot reach high speeds due to the bulk of their Sublight Drives.

EQUIPMENT.name: Sublight Drive (Speed 4)
EQUIPMENT.description: A Sublight Drive determines a ship's Speed when moving through Realspace. Replacing a ship's Sublight Drive can be expensive, and many ships cannot reach high speeds due to the bulk of their Sublight Drives.

EQUIPMENT.name: Sublight Drive (Speed 5)
EQUIPMENT.description: Only military vessels are permitted to use incredibly fast ion drives. A Sublight Drive determines a ship's Speed when moving through Realspace.

EQUIPMENT.name: Sublight Drive (Speed 6)
EQUIPMENT.description: Only military vessels are permitted to use incredibly fast ion drives. A Sublight Drive determines a ship's Speed when moving through Realspace.

EQUIPMENT.name: Shield Generator (SR 5)
EQUIPMENT.description: Not all Starships have deflector shields, and they are an extremely popular addition for those that lack them. However, the energy and space cost of Starship Shields is extremely high, and it grows with the size of the craft to be protected.

EQUIPMENT.name: Shield Generator (SR 10)
EQUIPMENT.description: Not all Starships have deflector shields, and they are an extremely popular addition for those that lack them. However, the energy and space cost of Starship Shields is extremely high, and it grows with the size of the craft to be protected.

EQUIPMENT.name: Shield Generator (SR 15)
EQUIPMENT.description: Not all Starships have deflector shields, and they are an extremely popular addition for those that lack them. However, the energy and space cost of Starship Shields is extremely high, and it grows with the size of the craft to be protected.

EQUIPMENT.name: Shield Generator (SR 20)
EQUIPMENT.description: Not all Starships have deflector shields, and they are an extremely popular addition for those that lack them. However, the energy and space cost of Starship Shields is extremely high, and it grows with the size of the craft to be protected.

EQUIPMENT.name: Shield Generator (SR 25)
EQUIPMENT.description: Not all Starships have deflector shields, and they are an extremely popular addition for those that lack them. However, the energy and space cost of Starship Shields is extremely high, and it grows with the size of the craft to be protected.

EQUIPMENT.name: Shield Generator (SR 30)
EQUIPMENT.description: Not all Starships have deflector shields, and they are an extremely popular addition for those that lack them. However, the energy and space cost of Starship Shields is extremely high, and it grows with the size of the craft to be protected.

EQUIPMENT.name: Shield Generator (SR 35)
EQUIPMENT.description: Not all Starships have deflector shields, and they are an extremely popular addition for those that lack them. However, the energy and space cost of Starship Shields is extremely high, and it grows with the size of the craft to be protected.

EQUIPMENT.name: Shield Generator (SR 40)
EQUIPMENT.description: Not all Starships have deflector shields, and they are an extremely popular addition for those that lack them. However, the energy and space cost of Starship Shields is extremely high, and it grows with the size of the craft to be protected.

EQUIPMENT.name: Shield Generator (SR 45)
EQUIPMENT.description: Not all Starships have deflector shields, and they are an extremely popular addition for those that lack them. However, the energy and space cost of Starship Shields is extremely high, and it grows with the size of the craft to be protected.

EQUIPMENT.name: Shield Generator (SR 50)
EQUIPMENT.description: Not all Starships have deflector shields, and they are an extremely popular addition for those that lack them. However, the energy and space cost of Starship Shields is extremely high, and it grows with the size of the craft to be protected.

EQUIPMENT.name: Shield Generator (SR 55)
EQUIPMENT.description: Not all Starships have deflector shields, and they are an extremely popular addition for those that lack them. However, the energy and space cost of Starship Shields is extremely high, and it grows with the size of the craft to be protected.

EQUIPMENT.name: Shield Generator (SR 60)
EQUIPMENT.description: Not all Starships have deflector shields, and they are an extremely popular addition for those that lack them. However, the energy and space cost of Starship Shields is extremely high, and it grows with the size of the craft to be protected.

EQUIPMENT.name: Reinforced Bulkheads (+10%)
EQUIPMENT.description: Reinforced Bulkheads increase a Starship's Hit Points by 10% (These improvements don't stack).

EQUIPMENT.name: Jamming Suite
EQUIPMENT.description: A Jamming Suite targets a single enemy within 6 squares. The target takes penalties on Use Computer checks (-4 for Starfighters, -2 for Space Transports) and enemy fire control systems.

EQUIPMENT.name: Cloaking Device (Hibridium)
EQUIPMENT.description: Grants Total Concealment. Produces 'Double-Blind' effect: occupants cannot see out while active. Treats all other targets as having Total Concealment.

EQUIPMENT.name: Cloaking Device (Stygium)
EQUIPMENT.description: Ancient and rare technology using Stygium crystals. Grants Total Concealment without the 'Double-Blind' penalty. Extremely expensive and hard to find.

EQUIPMENT.name: Backup Battery
EQUIPMENT.description: Allows ship to operate for 1 hour after power failure. Can reverse ionization damage (DC 25 Mechanics) but drains battery.

EQUIPMENT.name: HoloNet Transceiver
EQUIPMENT.description: Extremely rare and expensive systems that allow for real-time audio, visual, and holographic communication over an unlimited range via the HoloNet. Grants a +5 Equipment bonus to Use Computer checks made to gain information. During the Empire, availability is Military (normally Restricted/Rare).

EQUIPMENT.name: Hypertransceiver
EQUIPMENT.description: Hypertransceivers effectively have an unlimited range, allowing ships at opposite ends of the galaxy to communicate (with time lag). Allows access to information on The HoloNet.

EQUIPMENT.name: Lifeboat, Small
EQUIPMENT.description: Provide life support for up to 50 Medium creatures for 2 months. Includes Class 15 Hyperdrive. Can be installed on ships of Colossal (Frigate) size or larger. 1 Bay includes (Cost Mod)/100 Lifeboats.

EQUIPMENT.name: Droid Repair Team
EQUIPMENT.description: Automatically deploys to repair a Starship when it moves -1 or more steps down the Condition Track. Makes a +13 Mechanics check to Jury-Rig (+1 step). 25% chance of destruction if damage > SR while active.

EQUIPMENT.name: Medical Suite
EQUIPMENT.description: Includes (Size Mod)/5 medical beds and (Size Mod)/50 Bacta Tanks. Medical beds function as Medpac (10 uses), Medical Kit, and Surgery Kit.

EQUIPMENT.name: Passenger Conversion(Seating)
EQUIPMENT.description: Provides room for (Cost Mod) passengers (Seating). Steerage quality unless combined with Luxury Upgrade.

EQUIPMENT.name: Passenger Conversion
EQUIPMENT.description: Provides room for (Cost Mod) passengers (Quarters). Steerage quality unless combined with Luxury Upgrade.

EQUIPMENT.name: Sensor Array Computer (+2 Int)
EQUIPMENT.name_es: Ordenador de Matriz de Sensores (+2 Int)
EQUIPMENT.description: Exclusively processes sensor data, freeing the main computer. Grants +2 Equipment bonus to Intelligence.

EQUIPMENT.name: Sensor Array Computer (+4 Int)
EQUIPMENT.name_es: Ordenador de Matriz de Sensores (+4 Int)
EQUIPMENT.description: Exclusively processes sensor data, freeing the main computer. Grants +4 Equipment bonus to Intelligence.

EQUIPMENT.name: Sensor Array Computer (+6 Int)
EQUIPMENT.name_es: Ordenador de Matriz de Sensores (+6 Int)
EQUIPMENT.description: Exclusively processes sensor data, freeing the main computer. Grants +6 Equipment bonus to Intelligence.

EQUIPMENT.name: Sensor Enhancement Package
EQUIPMENT.description: Superior sensors providing better detection. Grants +5 bonus on Perception and Use Computer checks made to Use Sensors.

EQUIPMENT.name: Baffled Drive
EQUIPMENT.description: Uses supercooled Tibanna gas. Always Speed 2 (Starship Scale). Range 100 squares before refuel. +5 to DC to detect ship. Moving 2x speed doesn't negate Sensor Baffling.

EQUIPMENT.name: Amphibious Seals
EQUIPMENT.description: Allows Starship to function underwater. Swim speed 1/2 fly speed. Max underwater velocity 1/10 atmospheric.

EQUIPMENT.name: Cockpit Ejection System
EQUIPMENT.description: Allows cockpit to eject as an Escape Pod on ship destruction (DC 20 Pilot check to avoid damage).

EQUIPMENT.name: Cotterdam
EQUIPMENT.description: Flexible tube connecting two Colossal+ ships. Creates tunnel 3 squares long. Maneuvering to connect requires DC 15 Pilot check.

EQUIPMENT.name: Environmental Filters
EQUIPMENT.description: Allows ship to support multiple environments (gravity, atmosphere, etc.). Can be used offensively (DC 25 Use Computer) to flood sections with hazards.

EQUIPMENT.name: Fuel Converters
EQUIPMENT.description: Transform matter into usable Fuel. 1 hour gathering = 1 unit of fuel (1 day realspace / 1 jump).

EQUIPMENT.name: Grappler Mag
EQUIPMENT.description: Short-range grappling hook (Range 1). Can be used without power to attach clandestinely (Opposed Pilot/Stealth vs Pilot/Use Computer).

EQUIPMENT.name: Hardpoint (x4)
EQUIPMENT.description: External mounts for missiles/bombs. 1 Array = 4 Hardpoints. 1 Missile/Bomb = 1 HP (2 for Colossal weapons). Can also carry Drop Tanks. Half payload lost if Condition Track drops.

EQUIPMENT.name: Interrogation Chamber
EQUIPMENT.description: Converts a Holding Cell. Grants +5 Persuasion vs prisoners. Allows torture (+1 Dark Side).

EQUIPMENT.name: Personalized Controls
EQUIPMENT.description: Personalizes one crew position. +1 bonus on checks for owner, -2 penalty for others.

EQUIPMENT.name: Plasma Punch
EQUIPMENT.description: Bores through hull to create airlocks. Halves target DR for drilling time. Functions like Plasma Torch but faster and doesn't require Tractor Clamp.

EQUIPMENT.name: Plasma Torch
EQUIPMENT.description: Modification for Tractor Clamp. Cuts hole in secured ship's hull. 1 round per point of DR. Deal 1d6 damage per round to ship.

EQUIPMENT.name: Sensor Baffling
EQUIPMENT.description: Allows Stealth checks without Cover/Concealment. Benefit lost if moving > Speed.

EQUIPMENT.name: Sensor Decoy
EQUIPMENT.description: Missile that emulates a Starship on sensors. DC 25 Use Computer to identify. Revealed by visual range (1-20 squares depending on size). Includes 3 decoys.

EQUIPMENT.name: Sensor Mask
EQUIPMENT.description: Replicates sensor signals to make ship appear transparent. Adds +10 to DC of Use Computer checks to detect the ship.

EQUIPMENT.name: Tractor Clamp
EQUIPMENT.description: Secures enemy ships for boarding. +5 Grapple bonus to maintain hold. Includes boarding tube. Can equip Plasma Torch.

EQUIPMENT.name: Transponder (Masked)
EQUIPMENT.description: Code is impossible to read. Immediately apparent and suspicious.

EQUIPMENT.name: Transponder (Disguised) (1)
EQUIPMENT.description: Mimics another ship's code. Requires Use Computer + Deception check to install. -5 Deception for each additional disguised transponder.

EQUIPMENT.name: Transponder (Disguised) (2)
EQUIPMENT.description: Mimics another ship's code. Requires Use Computer + Deception check to install. -5 Deception for each additional disguised transponder.

EQUIPMENT.name: Transponder (Disguised) (3)
EQUIPMENT.description: Mimics another ship's code. Requires Use Computer + Deception check to install. -5 Deception for each additional disguised transponder.

EQUIPMENT.name: Transponder (IFF)
EQUIPMENT.description: Military Friend/Foe transponder. Can be loaded with codes to appear as 'Friend'. Can hack enemy computers to appear as Friend (Use Computer check).

EQUIPMENT.name: Workshop
EQUIPMENT.description: Fully equipped workshop. +2 Equipment bonus on Mechanics/Use Computer checks to repair/modify/construct objects.

EQUIPMENT.name: Slave Circuits (Basic)
EQUIPMENT.description: Reduces crew requirements by 1/3 (minimum 1).

EQUIPMENT.name: Slave Circuits (Advanced)
EQUIPMENT.description: Reduces crew requirements by 2/3 (minimum 1).

EQUIPMENT.name: Smuggler's Compartment
EQUIPMENT.description: Hidden cargo spaces. DC 30 Perception to find. Holds (Cost Mod) x 200 kg. Max 5% of total cargo capacity.

EQUIPMENT.name: Cargo Pod (Light)
EQUIPMENT.description: Additional storage space. Adds (Size Mod) x 1 tons of cargo. Reduces Dexterity by 2 (Min Dex 1).

EQUIPMENT.name: Cargo Pod (Medium)
EQUIPMENT.description: Additional storage space. Adds (Size Mod) x 5 tons of cargo. Reduces Dexterity by 2 (Min Dex 1).

EQUIPMENT.name: Cargo Pod (Heavy)
EQUIPMENT.description: Additional storage space. Adds (Size Mod) x 10 tons of cargo. Reduces Dexterity by 2 (Min Dex 1).

EQUIPMENT.name: Cargo Jettison System
EQUIPMENT.description: Allows a ship to dump part or all of its cargo into space without docking or slowing down as a Swift Action.

EQUIPMENT.name: Extended Range
EQUIPMENT.description: Improves a Starship's consumables by 10% of its original value (rounded down, minimum 1 day) x the number of times installed.

EQUIPMENT.name: Luxury Upgrade (Basic)
EQUIPMENT.description: Changes a Starship from a harsh travel vehicle to a comfortable home. Includes comfortable beds, wardrobes, recliners, and music systems. Requires monthly maintenance (1/50 of cost).

EQUIPMENT.name: Luxury Upgrade (Advanced)
EQUIPMENT.description: Makes the ship the equivalent of an upper-scale hotel. Gourmet cooking, quality artwork, and stylish trim. Requires monthly maintenance (1/50 of cost).

EQUIPMENT.name: Luxury Upgrade (Extreme)
EQUIPMENT.description: Turns a Starship into a palace in space. Increases Crew Quality by one step (max Expert), though this has no effect on hero statistics. Requires monthly maintenance (1/50 of cost).

EQUIPMENT.name: Hangar Bay
EQUIPMENT.description: Holds secondary craft. Each bay has (Cost Modifier)/50 units of hangar space (Huge=1, Gargantuan=5, Colossal=20). Can be combined.

EQUIPMENT.name: Hangar Bay, Concealed
EQUIPMENT.description: Functions as Hangar Bay but requires DC 30 Perception to notice externally. Launch/Land takes 2 Full-Round Actions.

EQUIPMENT.name: Cryogenic Chambers
EQUIPMENT.description: Hibernation systems that allow live creatures to be carried in stasis. Capacity: (Cost Mod)/5 Medium creatures per unit. Large=5x space, Huge=20x.

EQUIPMENT.name: Docking Clamp
EQUIPMENT.description: Used to carry smaller ships (e.g. TIE Fighters on a Gozanti). A Starship can maneuver and Hyperspace with ships attached. If ship takes damage > Threshold, clamped ships are shaken off.

EQUIPMENT.name: Starship Armor (+1)
EQUIPMENT.description: Starship Armor is bought as an Equipment bonus to the Armor a Starship adds to its Reflex Defense. Skilled pilots often prefer ships without heavy armor, since they can use their Character Level in place of a ship's Armor bonus in any case.

EQUIPMENT.name: Starship Armor (+2)
EQUIPMENT.description: Starship Armor is bought as an Equipment bonus to the Armor a Starship adds to its Reflex Defense. Skilled pilots often prefer ships without heavy armor, since they can use their Character Level in place of a ship's Armor bonus in any case.

EQUIPMENT.name: Starship Armor (+3)
EQUIPMENT.description: Starship Armor is bought as an Equipment bonus to the Armor a Starship adds to its Reflex Defense. Skilled pilots often prefer ships without heavy armor, since they can use their Character Level in place of a ship's Armor bonus in any case.

EQUIPMENT.name: Starship Armor (+4)
EQUIPMENT.description: Starship Armor is bought as an Equipment bonus to the Armor a Starship adds to its Reflex Defense. Skilled pilots often prefer ships without heavy armor, since they can use their Character Level in place of a ship's Armor bonus in any case.

EQUIPMENT.name: Jamming Array
EQUIPMENT.description: A Jamming Array affects all enemy Starships within 6 squares, regardless of size. The penalty on Use Computer checks is -6 for Starfighters, -4 for Space Transports, and -2 for Capital Ships.

EQUIPMENT.name: Regenerating Shields
EQUIPMENT.description: If a ship possesses Regenerating Shields, its current Shield Rating increases by 10 (Up to its maximum Shield Rating) when a System Operator uses the Recharge Shields Action.

EQUIPMENT.name: Reinforced Bulkheads (+20%)
EQUIPMENT.description: Reinforced Bulkheads increase a Starship's Hit Points by 20% (These improvements don't stack).

EQUIPMENT.name: Reinforced Bulkheads (+30%)
EQUIPMENT.description: Reinforced Bulkheads increase a Starship's Hit Points by 30% (These improvements don't stack).

EQUIPMENT.name: Anti-Boarding Systems
EQUIPMENT.description: Anti-Boarding Systems include blast doors (DR 10, 250 HP), security cameras, and blaster rifle turrets at vital locations. The system has independent backup power allowing turrets to make up to 50 shots after power loss.

EQUIPMENT.name: Com Jammers
EQUIPMENT.description: A Com Jammer prevents any communication within 6 squares. It takes a DC 30 Use Computer check to send or receive a message within this area. The jamming ship is also affected and is easier to detect (+20 to sensors checks).

EQUIPMENT.name: Reinforced Keel
EQUIPMENT.description: A Reinforced Keel causes the ship to take only half damage from Collisions. If the ship Rams another, it deals +2 damage per die.

EQUIPMENT.name: Reinforced Keel, Boarding
EQUIPMENT.description: Boarding Keels function as Reinforced Keels but can also dock with an enemy ship after a successful ram that moves the target down the Condition Track, allowing boarders to invade.

EQUIPMENT.name: Security Bracing
EQUIPMENT.description: Security Bracing protects Passenger Conversions and Escape Pods. When the ship is destroyed by massive damage, subtract the ship's DR from damage dealt to anyone in the protected area.

EQUIPMENT.name: Light Turbolaser
EQUIPMENT.description: Turbolasers require immense power and cooling. Light Turbolasers can be Fire-Linked with Autofire.

EQUIPMENT.name: Medium Turbolaser
EQUIPMENT.description: Turbolasers require immense power and cooling. Most Turbolasers are incapable of Autofire due to longer firing sequences.

EQUIPMENT.name: Heavy Turbolaser
EQUIPMENT.description: Turbolasers require immense power and cooling. Most Turbolasers are incapable of Autofire due to longer firing sequences.

EQUIPMENT.name: Light Blaster Cannon
EQUIPMENT.description: Blaster Cannons are frequently mounted on Starfighters. They are less expensive than Laser Cannons but have a more limited range.

EQUIPMENT.name: Medium Blaster Cannon
EQUIPMENT.description: Blaster Cannons are frequently mounted on Starfighters. They are less expensive than Laser Cannons but have a more limited range.

EQUIPMENT.name: Heavy Blaster Cannon
EQUIPMENT.description: Blaster Cannons are frequently mounted on Starfighters. They are less expensive than Laser Cannons but have a more limited range.

EQUIPMENT.name: Harpoon Gun
EQUIPMENT.description: A Gunner may use the Harpoon Gun to make a Grapple check against a target Walker. If the Grapple check succeeds, the target Walker cannot move without first making a Pilot check (DC = Harpoon Gun's Grapple check result). If this Pilot check fails, the Walker suffers an automatic Collision, taking twice its Collision damage.

EQUIPMENT.name: Docking Gun(WIP)
EQUIPMENT.description: Allows Character Scale Ranged Weapons to be added as a Docking Gun. Counts as Heavy Weapon. Draws power from ship. The cost is for the mount only - the gun itself is bought normally. Docking Guns have no effect on Starship Scale combat.

EQUIPMENT.name: Droid Jammer
EQUIPMENT.description: Attacks from the Starship gain a +2 Equipment bonus to hit automated craft (like Droid Starfighters) within a 5-square radius.

EQUIPMENT.name: Gravity Well Projector
EQUIPMENT.description: A Gravity Well Projector creates an artificial gravity well that prevents Hyperspace travel. Any Starship within 12 squares of an active Gravity Well Projector cannot activate its Hyperdrive. Additionally, any ship traveling through Hyperspace that passes within 12 squares of the active Gravity Well Projector is immediately pulled out of Hyperspace.

EQUIPMENT.name: Ion Bomb Rack
EQUIPMENT.description: Ion Bombs deal 5d10 Ion damage in a 2-square burst area. However, they are unguided weapons and take a -5 penalty on attack rolls against moving targets (speed > 0). A rack Holds up too 4 bombs

EQUIPMENT.name: Shieldbuster Torpedo Launcher
EQUIPMENT.description: A specialized torpedo designed to overload shielding systems. On a hit, it reduces the target's Shield Rating by -10 (instead of the usual -5). Shields damaged in this way can be recharged normally.

EQUIPMENT.name: Space Mine Launcher, Standard
EQUIPMENT.description: Space Mines are stationary explosives deployed in space. If a ship enters a square containing a Space Mine, it detonates, dealing energy damage to that ship depending of payload.

EQUIPMENT.name: Space Mine Launcher, Heavy
EQUIPMENT.description: Space Mines are stationary explosives deployed in space. If a ship enters a square containing a Space Mine, it detonates, dealing 6d10x2 Energy damage to that ship.

EQUIPMENT.name: Discord Missile Launcher
EQUIPMENT.description: Deploys a buzz droid swarm on the target ship. The target takes 2d10 damage per turn (ignoring DR and SR) until the droids are removed or destroyed. Requires a successful attack roll to hit.

EQUIPMENT.name: Composite Beam Cannon
EQUIPMENT.description: A laser weapon that ignores 5 points of the target's Shield Rating (treat SR as 5 lower against this attack).

EQUIPMENT.name: Gravity Mine Launcher
EQUIPMENT.description: Detonates when a ship enters the square, creating a temporary gravity well that prevents Hyperspace travel for 1 round and deals 4d10x2 Energy damage.

EQUIPMENT.name: Chaff Gun
EQUIPMENT.description: Launches a cloud of sensor-confusing debris. Provides concealment and imposes a -5 penalty on attack rolls and Pilot checks for missiles and sensors attempting to target the ship.

EQUIPMENT.name: Auxiliary Generator (+2)
EQUIPMENT.description: Supplies power to specific systems. Gives a +2 equipment bonus to Strength. Allows systems to continue when engines are shut down.

EQUIPMENT.name: Auxiliary Generator (+4)
EQUIPMENT.description: Supplies power to specific systems. Gives a +4 equipment bonus to Strength.

EQUIPMENT.name: Auxiliary Generator (+6)
EQUIPMENT.description: Supplies power to specific systems. Gives a +6 equipment bonus to Strength.

EQUIPMENT.name: Hidden Cargo Hold (25%)
EQUIPMENT.description: Converts 25% of cargo space into hidden compartments (-5 to Perception checks to find).

EQUIPMENT.name: Hidden Cargo Hold (50%)
EQUIPMENT.description: Converts 50% of cargo space into hidden compartments.

EQUIPMENT.name: Hidden Cargo Hold (75%)
EQUIPMENT.description: Converts 75% of cargo space into hidden compartments.

EQUIPMENT.name: Heavy Ordnance Launcher
EQUIPMENT.description: Launches heavy ordnance payloads.

EQUIPMENT.name: Lifeboat, Large
EQUIPMENT.description: Provide life support for up to 50 Medium creatures for 2 months. Includes Class 15 Hyperdrive. Can be installed on ships of Colossal (Frigate) size or larger.
